1: <sup>1</sup> Paul and Timotheus, the servants of Jesus Christ, to all the saints in Christ Jesus which are at Philippi, with the bishops and deacons:
2: <sup>2</sup> Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
3: <sup>3</sup> I thank my God upon every remembrance of you,
4: <sup>4</sup> Always in every prayer of mine for you all making request with joy,
5: <sup>5</sup> For your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now;
6: <sup>6</sup> Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ:
7: <sup>7</sup> Even as it is meet for me to think this of you all, because I have you in my heart; inasmuch as both in my bonds, and in the defence and confirmation of the gospel, ye all are partakers of my grace.
8: <sup>8</sup> For God is my record, how greatly I long after you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ.
9: <sup>9</sup> And this I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and in all judgment;
10: <sup>10</sup> That ye may approve things that are excellent; that ye may be sincere and without offence till the day of Christ.
11: <sup>11</sup> Being filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ, unto the glory and praise of God.
12: <sup>12</sup> But I would ye should understand, brethren, that the things which happened unto me have fallen out rather unto the furtherance of the gospel;
13: <sup>13</sup> So that my bonds in Christ are manifest in all the palace, and in all other places;
14: <sup>14</sup> And many of the brethren in the Lord, waxing confident by my bonds, are much more bold to speak the word without fear.
15: <sup>15</sup> Some indeed preach Christ even of envy and strife; and some also of good will:
16: <sup>16</sup> The one preach Christ of contention, not sincerely, supposing to add affliction to my bonds:
17: <sup>17</sup> But the other of love, knowing that I am set for the defence of the gospel.
18: <sup>18</sup> What then? notwithstanding, every way, whether in pretence, or in truth, Christ is preached; and I therein do rejoice, yea, and will rejoice.
19: <sup>19</sup> For I know that this shall turn to my salvation through your prayer, and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,
20: <sup>20</sup> According to my earnest expectation and my hope, that in nothing I shall be ashamed, but that with all boldness, as always, so now also Christ shall be magnified in my body, whether it be by life, or by death.
21: <sup>21</sup> For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain.
22: <sup>22</sup> But if I live in the flesh, this is the fruit of my labour: yet what I shall choose I wot not.
23: <sup>23</sup> For I am in a strait betwixt two, having a desire to depart, and to be with Christ; which is far better:
24: <sup>24</sup> Nevertheless to abide in the flesh is more needful for you.
25: <sup>25</sup> And having this confidence, I know that I shall abide and continue with you all for your furtherance and joy of faith;
26: <sup>26</sup> That your rejoicing may be more abundant in Jesus Christ for me by my coming to you again.
27: <sup>27</sup> Only let your conversation be as it becometh the gospel of Christ: that whether I come and see you, or else be absent, I may hear of your affairs, that ye stand fast in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel;
28: <sup>28</sup> And in nothing terrified by your adversaries: which is to them an evident token of perdition, but to you of salvation, and that of God.
29: <sup>29</sup> For unto you it is given in the behalf of Christ, not only to believe on him, but also to suffer for his sake;
30: <sup>30</sup> Having the same conflict which ye saw in me, and now hear to be in me.
